docs.snippet: BERGMAN--Philip S., former ABC News Producer for "20/20," "Nightline," "World News Tonight," "Good Morning America," and the "ABC Saturday Evening News," died on April 6, after a long battle with Alzheimer's Disease. He was 82 years old. Mr. Bergm...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BERGMAN--Philip S.,

former ABC News Producer for "20/20," "Nightline," "World News Tonight," "Good Morning America," and the "ABC Saturday Evening News," died on April 6, after a long battle with Alzheimer's Disease. He was 82 years old. Mr. Bergman was an American journalist and television news producer. He spent the bulk of his professional career with ABC News, producing news documentaries and stories for a variety of programs including "20/20", "Nightline", "World News Tonight" and the "ABC Saturday Evening News with Ted Koppel." Philip Bergman was born October 21, 1933 in New York City. After attending City College of New York, Mr. Bergman began his professional career as a reporter and editor at the Newark Star-Ledger and later worked as a reporter for United Press International. He served in the U.S. Army from 1957 to 1962, where he served as an Army correspondent. In 1962, Mr. Bergman joined ABC as a writer for WABC-TV News, and from 1964-1967 he produced WABC-TV's late night news program. In 1976, Mr. Bergman took the helm as Executive Producer for the ABC Saturday Evening News. After several years as a Senior Producer for ABC's "World News Tonight," Mr. Bergman went on to produce stories and segments for other prominent network news programs, including "Nightline" and "20/20." Over the course of his career, Phil Bergman won numerous awards including five national Emmy Awards, two national Headline Awards, a Christopher Award, and an Aviation and Space Writer's Award for TV and Radio. Loved and adored husband of late Irene for 46 years. Devoted father of sons, Michael and Jason. Loving father-in- law to Jill. Cherished grandfather of Hailey, Shari, Jordan, and Jared. Loving brother to late Cyril and Jules. Son of late parents Ruth and Irving Bergman. Graveside services are 11am, Friday, April 8, 2016 at Cedar Park Cemetery, 735 Forest Ave., Paramus, NJ.

docs.snippet: REICHENBACH--Karen. Passed peacefully with family by her side on April 5. Loving wife of Herb and mother to Samantha and Jenna. Family was her greatest joy; always in touch with her Southern roots. Quilter extraordinaire, master gardener, designer...
docs.lead_paragraph: REICHENBACH--Karen. Passed peacefully with family by her side on April 5. Loving wife of Herb and mother to Samantha and Jenna. Family was her greatest joy; always in touch with her Southern roots. Quilter extraordinaire, master gardener, designer, Village Trustee, and cultural enthusiast. Her passion for life and infectious laughter will be dearly missed. Memorial Service Saturday, April 9, 9:30am at UUCSR, 48 Shelter Rock Rd., Manhasset, NY. Donations may be made to the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund Alliance.

docs.snippet: CLARK--Robert Henry Jr., Case, Pomeroy & Company mourns the loss of Robert "Bob" Henry Clark, Jr., who served the Company for 45 years with exceptional skill and dedication. Mr. Clark died peacefully on March 30, 2016 at his home in Naples, FL aft...
docs.lead_paragraph:
CLARK--Robert Henry Jr.,

Case, Pomeroy & Company mourns the loss of Robert "Bob" Henry Clark, Jr., who served the Company for 45 years with exceptional skill and dedication. Mr. Clark died peacefully on March 30, 2016 at his home in Naples, FL after a prolonged battle with cancer. He was 75 years old. After starting his career at Merrill Lynch, Mr. Clark joined Case, Pomeroy & Co. in New York City in 1971. The investment firm was co-founded in 1916 by his wife, Rosalie Case's grandfather, Walter S. Case and later led by her father, Hadley Case. Over various periods of Mr. Clark's distinguished tenure with the Company, he held the offices of President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman. He also served as a director of Homestake Mining Company from 1984 until 2001, in addition to other private and public companies, and served as a Trustee of Boston University, his Alma Mater, from 1984 until 1987. We extend our deepest condolences to his wife of 52 years, Rosalie Case, his son, Robert H. Clark III and his wife, Jennifer L. Nolen of Roanoke, VA, his daughter, Hilary E. Clark of New York, NY, his son, Hadley C. Clark and his wife, Sara B. Stonner of Larchmont, NY, and four grandchildren. He is also survived by his sister, Sarah Clark Paquette of Minneola, FL. In lieu of flowers, the family has asked that donations may be made to the Castle Preservation Society, P.O. Box 687, Moultonborough, NH 03254.

docs.snippet: BINGHAM--Arthur Walker III. The Church Club of New York is deeply saddened by the death of its long-term Life Member and past Church Club President. Our sincere condolences are extended to his wife Nicolette, also a Church Club Life Member, and to...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BINGHAM--Arthur Walker III.

The Church Club of New York is deeply saddened by the death of its long-term Life Member and past Church Club President. Our sincere condolences are extended to his wife Nicolette, also a Church Club Life Member, and to the family. Nancy Fisher, President

docs.snippet: SELNICK--Phyllis Solomon, 80, of New York City, passed away suddenly Monday, April 4, 2016. Phyllis was born in Springfield, MA on November 2, 1935 to the late Joseph and Anna Solomon. As a graduate of both Boston and Columbia Universities, she wo...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SELNICK--Phyllis Solomon,

80, of New York City, passed away suddenly Monday, April 4, 2016. Phyllis was born in Springfield, MA on November 2, 1935 to the late Joseph and Anna Solomon. As a graduate of both Boston and Columbia Universities, she worked for many years as a social worker. She then went on to receive a degree in folk art and subsequently became a volunteer at the American Museum of Folk Art and has built a world class collection of Folk Art paintings. She is survived by both her devoted and loving husband Al Selnick, married 46 years and by her brother Marshall Solomon who will forever cherish her memory. A memorial service will be held on Friday, April 8th at 11:30am: Campbell Funeral Home located at 1076 Madison Ave in New York City, NY (81st St). In lieu of flowers, the family has suggested donations in memory of Phyllis be made to the Holocaust Museum, Ronald McDonald House or to the American Museum of Folk Art.

docs.snippet: LYONS--Mari, painter, died peacefully on April 3 from cancer. She was 80 years old. Her passing is a profound loss to her beloved, devoted husband of 58 years, Nick, and their four children: Paul (and Monica Ghosh), Charles, Jennifer (Steve Brenna...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LYONS--Mari,

painter, died peacefully on April 3 from cancer. She was 80 years old. Her passing is a profound loss to her beloved, devoted husband of 58 years, Nick, and their four children: Paul (and Monica Ghosh), Charles, Jennifer (Steve Brennan), and Tony (and Helena Hjalmarsson); and their grandchildren, Lara, Finn, Lina, and Elsa. Mari attended the Anna Head School, Bard College, Yale Norfolk, the Grand Chaumiere, Atelier l7, and the Cranbrook Academy of Art (MFA). She studied as well at Mills College with Fletcher Martin and Max Beckmann. She was a fiercely committed painter all of her life, who painted with sheer joy, in all genres, and loved the works of the great painters. Mari exhibited regularly with First Street Gallery in New York. More about her life and art is available at www.marilyonsstudio.com

headline.main: OCBC to Buy Bulk of Barclays' Asian Wealth Management Unit for $320 Million
headline.print_headline: OCBC to Buy Bulk of Barclays' Asian Wealth Management Unit for $320 Million

docs.snippet: Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp has agreed to buy Barclays' wealth management operations in Singapore and Hong Kong for $320 million (226.64 million pounds), its second major private banking deal since 2009....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp has agreed to buy Barclays' wealth management operations in Singapore and Hong Kong for $320 million (226.64 million pounds), its second major private banking deal since 2009.
